bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Thomas Derrick, 1885-1954, was an English artist, illustrator, and cartoonist. He was born in Bristol and studied at the Royal College of Art, where he later became an instructor in decorative painting. Derrick worked in stained-glass, murals, and portraiture. He was an exhibitor at the Royal Academy, though never a member. He contributed his work to such publications as Punch, the Douai Magazine, and G. K.'s Weekly. Derrick also designed posters for the London Underground and worked as a book illustrator.
